title: Lowering of flags for Pope Francis reignites secularism debate in France
summary: Some left-wing political leaders have condemned what they see as a breach of France's neutrality principle. While some mayors refuse to follow the directive, far-right and right-wing officials have obeyed the national instructions.

title: Pope Francis's funeral in photos
summary: The funeral took place on the steps of Saint Peter's Basilica on Saturday and was attended by presidents, heads of government and monarchs, including Donald Trump and Emmanuel Macron. The pope was then interred in the Basilica of Saint Mary Major.

title: Women's Six Nations: England wins grand slam after one-point victory over France
summary: England won a seventh successive Women's Six Nations title after surviving a sensational France fightback by 43-42 at Twickenham on Saturday.

title: Trump urges 'free' transit for US ships through Panama and Suez canals
summary: In a post on his Truth Social platform, the US president claimed on Saturday that both routes would 'not exist' without the United States. He said he had asked Secretary of State Marco Rubio to 'immediately take care of' the situation.

title: A dive into the sources of the Seine in Burgundy
summary: It's in a public park 40 kilometers from Dijon that the waters of France's second-longest river spring. A property of the city of Paris, one can take a stroll among the garden paths and statues to the sound of lapping water.

title: The surprising evolutionary convergence of two Californian stick insects
summary: To camouflage themselves on different plants, two forms of this mimic insect bear different patterns on their backs. Researchers have determined that two populations separated for over a million years have mutated concurrently.

title: 14 dead and 750 people injured by explosion in Iranian port
summary: The blast happened at the Rajaei port on Saturday morning. Social media videos showed black billowing smoke after the blast. Authorities have offered no cause for the explosion so far.

title: Trump and Zelensky hold 'constructive' exchange at pope's funeral
summary: The American president spoke with his Ukrainian counterpart on the sidelines of Pope Francis's funeral on Saturday and agreed to further talks.

title: UK activist group Just Stop Oil holds final march, shifting focus away from civil disobedience
summary: Several hundred supporters walked peacefully through the center of London, from Parliament to the headquarters of oil and gas giant Shell. The environmental group announced in March it would halt its headline-grabbing protests.

title: Epstein accuser Virginia Giuffre dies by suicide aged 41
summary: Giuffre had accused Jeffrey Epstein of using her as a sex slave and said she had sex with Prince Andrew when she was 17  after meeting him through the American billionaire.

title: Finding housing in Paris is getting harder – even for young people making good money
summary: While the housing crisis in the French capital primarily affects the most vulnerable, it has become so severe that even young employees with a monthly income of €3,000 are struggling.

title: Trump administration reverses decision to cancel student visas
summary: Thousands of students have had their residency permits revoked without explanation in recent weeks. But immigration authorities announced during several court hearings on Friday that their documents would be reactivated pending the development of a framework allowing for cancelations.

title: 'Tech magnates could turn against Trump'
summary: While the illegality of many decisions by the American president had previously left his Silicon Valley allies indifferent, they are increasingly alarmed by the cost of his trade policy, reports law expert Anne Deysine.

title: In Syria, Israel and Turkey maneuver for power
summary: Since the fall of Bashar al-Assad, Israel has exploited the weakness of the new Syrian government to carry out cross-border operations in the name of its security, while Recep Tayyip Erdogan seeks to assert his influence in the region.

title: Women's Six Nations: France face their nemesis in the 'final'
summary: The French women's rugby team faces the formidable English team on Saturday at Twickenham. The team that wins the match will claim the tournament and leave a mark just months before the World Cup.

title: War in Ukraine: Here is what Kyiv's allies and opponents propose to obtain peace
summary: Diplomatic initiatives are multiplying to end the conflict, but significant disagreements persist among Ukrainians, Russians, Americans and Europeans regarding the conditions for a lasting peace.

title: US holds third round of high-stakes nuclear talks with Iran
summary: US special envoy Steve Witkoff, who arrived in Oman for talks on Saturday, last met Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi on April 19. The first meeting was held on April 12.

title: Abidjan, the other capital of French rap
summary: While Kaaris, born in Côte d'Ivoire, headlined the Anoumabo Urban Music Festival, the whole avant-garde of young Franco-Ivorian artists like Le Juiice, Lala & ce, Laylow, Jeune Lion and Jok'Air are splitting their time between the two countries.

title: French films are still very popular in Russia
summary: In 2024, Russia was the second-largest market for French films globally, just behind Germany.

title: More than 100 Gaza Strip residents evacuated to France: 'You can't imagine what we've been through'
summary: One hundred fifteen Palestinians, including recipients of the PAUSE university hosting program and scholarship students, landed at Orly on Friday in the largest evacuation to France since October 7.

title: Israeli spy chief's accusations against Netanyahu raise political crisis to new peak
summary: Ronen Bar, head of the Shin Bet, Israel's domestic intelligence agency, who was dismissed by the government, has submitted a statement to the Supreme Court accusing Benjamin Netanyahu of breaching the rule of law.

title: 80 years ago, French women finally voted for the first time
summary: On April 29, 1945, women in France were able to vote for the first time. Today, some centenarians remember these historic municipal elections. They emphasize that they obtained this right from the provisional government of General Charles de Gaulle in 1944 thanks to their active participation in the Resistance.

title: Several killed after car driven into Vancouver street festival crowd
summary: A car plowed into a crowd celebrating the Filipino holiday of Lapu Lapu Day on Saturday night. The driver has been taken into custody.

title: French police hunt killer of Muslim worshipper inside mosque
summary: The attacker stabbed the worshiper dozens of times then filmed him with a mobile phone while shouting insults at Islam in Friday's attack in a village in southern France.

title: 'The Church is us': Hundreds of thousands attend pope's funeral at the Vatican
summary: Pope Francis was laid to rest in the Basilica of St. Mary Major in Rome on Saturday after a funeral mass at St. Peter's Square. The ceremony was attended by dozens of monarchs and heads of state, along with an immense crowd of faithful, paying tribute to a pope who was close to the people.

title: Aid workers sound the alarm over Gaza's transformation into 'mass grave'
summary: Since March 2, Israel's complete blockade risks turning the Gaza Strip into a 'mass grave,' according to humanitarian workers who are increasingly threatened on the ground, writes historian Jean-Pierre Filiu in his column.

title: Cable ships, guardian angels of the global internet network
summary: As submarine telecoms cable cuts have multiplied in recent months, 'Le Monde' was able to board the 'Sophie-Germain,' Orange Marine's - and the world's - most modern repair vessel.

title: How China is trying to force Trump to back down, even if it means making trade concessions
summary: Beijing has reiterated that it is not engaging in direct discussions with the US government. Both countries are taking measures to try to limit the impact of the prohibitive tariffs by excluding certain products.

title: Ethiopia's Assefa breaks world record to win London marathon, Kenya's Sawe wins men's race
summary: Tigst Assefa made up for coming second in last year's marathon to coast home in the women's London Marathon in a world record time of 2hr 15min 50sec on Sunday. Kenya's Sabastian Sawe won the men's London marathon in a time of 2hr 02min 27sec.

title: Europe's cultural exception under attack from the Americans
summary: Representatives of studios, directors and film technicians are aligning with the Trump administration, which seeks to dismantle anything that limits the dominance of American platforms.

title: Firefighters fight to put out blaze after Iran port explosion leaves at least nine dead
summary: More than a thousand people were also injured after a massive explosion ripped through Iran's largest commercial port on Saturday.

title: Canada's Arctic territory is increasingly vulnerable to external threats
summary: Due to Donald Trump's unpredictability and Russia and China's ambitions, Canadian researchers and intelligence agents agree Canada must reinforce its Arctic strategy or risk losing control of a significant portion of its territory.

title: No place for racism in France, says Macron after worshiper stabbed to death in mosque
summary: The attacker, who is still on the run, stabbed the worshiper dozens of times and then filmed him with a mobile phone while shouting insults at Islam in Friday's attack in a village in southern France.

title: In Tunisia, Kais Saied's headlong rush toward autocracy
summary: A sham trial resulting in the conviction of some 40 critics, with sentences reaching up to 66 years in prison, illustrates the repressive escalation that has gripped the birthplace of the Arab Spring since 2021.

title: Napoleon letter denying he ordered pope kidnapping sells at Paris auction
summary: The hand-written letter from Napoleon rejecting his role in the kidnapping of Pope Pius VII in 1809 sold for €26,360 at an auction on Sunday.
